bill_title: revise provisions regarding assault committed against certain persons.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise provisions regarding assault committed against certain persons. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 22-18-1.05 be amended to read: 22-18-1.05. Simple assault, as provided in § 22-18-1, if committed against a law enforcement officer, Department of Corrections employee or person under contract assigned to the Department of Corrections, or other public officer, which assault occurred while such whether or not the officer or employee was engaged in the performance of the officer's or employee's duties, is a Class 6 felony. Aggravated assault, as provided in § 22-18-1.1, if committed against a law enforcement officer, Department of Corrections employee or person under contract assigned to the Department of Corrections, or other public officer, which assault occurred while such whether or not the officer or employee was engaged in the performance of the officer's or employee's duties, is a Class 2 felony. 100 copies were printed on recycled paper by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.167 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise provisions regarding assault committed against certain persons. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 22-18-1.05 be amended to read: 22-18-1.05. Simple assault, as provided in § 22-18-1, if knowingly committed against a law enforcement officer, Department of Corrections employee or person under contract assigned to the Department of Corrections, or other public officer, which assault occurred while such whether or not the officer or employee was engaged in the performance of the officer's or employee's duties, is a Class 6 felony. Aggravated assault, as provided in § 22-18-1.1, if knowingly committed against a law enforcement officer, Department of Corrections employee or person under contract assigned to the Department of Corrections, or other public officer, which assault occurred while such whether or not the officer or employee was engaged in the performance of the officer's or employee's duties, is a Class 2 felony. 100 copies were printed on recycled paper by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.167 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
